On the studio version,  Freddie Mercury sings the intro and chorus while his voice is harmonised with an upper voice (Roger Taylor) and a lower voice (Brian May). Despite being harder to pull off live, the band would still attempt their trickery, often with Brian singing lead in the chorus.

I’ve been singing with my band
 Cross the water, cross the land
 I’ve seen every blue eyed
 Floozy on the way, hey

Prior to the release of Jazz,, Queen had already been on several tours throughout the UK, and even the US for their News Of The World album tour. Brian May, who wrote the track, is simply stating how these experiences with the band have led him to see many different women who he describes as “floozies”. Floozy is an often derogatory term for people who are boastful about their sexual relations with other people.

On the studio version,  Freddie Mercury sings the intro and chorus while his voice is harmonised with an upper voice (Roger Taylor) and a lower voice (Brian May). Despite being harder to pull off live, the band would still attempt their trickery, often with Brian singing lead in the chorus.

But I knew life before
 I left my nursery, huh
 Left alone with big fat Fanny
 She was such a naughty nanny
 Hey, big woman
 You made a bad boy out of me

Often, a young man will experience his first sexual arousal in response to an older woman, the mere sight of her giving the boy a focus for his desire.

Van Halen’s “Hot for Teacher”, and “Stacy’s Mom”, by Fountains of Wayne also cover this territory.

Fanny is not only a name for a woman, but also a slang term for the buttocks in America and for the vagina in the UK and Australia.
Get on your bikes and ride!

This references the song “Bicycle Race”, also from Jazz, which in turn references this song. The two songs were released together as a ‘Double A-side’ single.

The original cover for the single was a photo of a fully nude woman riding a bicycle, but many stores refused to sell it. The recording company released an alternate cover with panties painted on.

In turn of this song referencing it, Bicycle Race also refers Fat Bottomed Girls:

Fat bottomed girls will be riding today, so look out for those beauties oh yeah.
